description: Application under Section 73A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 1 (Approved Plans) and Condition 8 (Materials) of Planning Permission ref: 18/12758/FUL (Variation to condition 2 (plans) and condition 4 (times of use) of planning permission 17/13104/FUL - Formation of 14 new car parking spaces and new vehicular crossover (revisions)) dated 11/08/2020. Variation to include changes of materials to match existing
decision_conditions: Notwithstanding the details shown on drawing 3214-05 Rev G, a  detailed landscaping scheme including species and size at time of planting shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 3 months from the commencement of development.  The approved scheme shall provide additional tree planting around the western, southern and northern perimeters of the car park and shall be implemented within the first planting season following completion of the development, with the tree planting and landscaping thereafter being maintained for five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or shrubs which die, are removed, or become diseased during this period shall be replaced in the next planting season, and the area shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose only. Alterations that affect these approved landscape details must be previously agreed to in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: In the interests of visual amenity and also that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the Statement of Tree Protection measures dated 20 January 2018 as approved under permission 18/12758/FUL dated 11.08.2020.  The approved protection scheme shall be implemented prior to commencement of any work on site and maintained to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority until the completion of the development.Reason: In the interests of visual amenities and so that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

All new external materials and finishes shall be those specified on drawing 3214-05 Rev H Proposed Site Plan Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of this listed building is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM 12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Before any works to the boundary wall on to Portsmouth Road, a detailed photographic record of the front boundary wall shall be undertaken and submitted to the Local Planning Authority. Those parts of the wall to be removed shall either be reused on site or stored permanently on the site to allow possible reuse in the future.  All works of making good the wall shall be undertaken to match the existing original wall in respect of materials used, and detailed finished appearance and completed prior to beneficial use of the parking area hereby approved. Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of this listed building is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The southern car park shall not be used except on weekends and between the hours of 18:30 & 23:30 on weekdays, and on feast days, weddings, baptisms, funerals and any other day that is authorised by the Parish Priest for special occasions.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of this listed building is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved drawings, additional detailed drawings (plans, elevations, sections and details and specifications of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any alteration to the front boundary wall:(i)   	Alterations to the front boundary wall to create new access and of any retaining wall (at a scale of 1:10 / 1:20 or other scale agreed by the Local Planning Authority).(ii)  	Details of car park signage to notify of the restricted times of use specified under the terms of condition 3.(iii) Details of the  proposed heavy locking duty chain to be fixed across the accessway  and  metal posts either side of the access driveway, including fixing details.The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of this listed building is safeguarded in accordance with Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
